body:
### Problem

Hi there!
I'm sometimes using nvim inside tmux that runs inside tmux, which runs in Konsole.
(In some cases I even pass KONSOLE_* variables over ssh to make some nvim-irrelevant things to work).

As far as I understand, `nvim` detects whether it runs in `konsole`/`yakuake` by checking `KONSOLE_DBUS_SESSION` variable.
And, it seems, that check has higher priority over checking for tmux (although, I failed to find an evidence in `src/nvim/tui/tui.c`).

Anyway, the problem is that nvim doestn't change cursor shape when it runs inside tmux (where I have set up overriding of `Se`/`Ss` to `Konsole`'s code) and there is `KONSOLE_DBUS_SESSION` variable in the environment.

If I unset it, it works like a charm.


Also, previously I had following in the config, but it stoped working since one of the last updates:
```Lua
-- hack to stop nvim to detect Konsole when in tmux
-- (I made cursor management stuff in tmux instead).    
if os.getenv("TERM"):match"^tmux*" then    
  cmd([[unlet $KONSOLE_DBUS_SERVICE | unlet $KONSOLE_DBUS_SESSION | ]]    
    .. [[unlet $KONSOLE_PROFILE_NAME | unlet $KONSOLE_VERSION]])    
end
```

Looks like now nvim checks cursor shaping things before reading the config :shrug: 

Anyway, I don't know how to resolve that issue, as I need those variables to be set for other things to work, so I can't unset them in the shell.
And, it seems, there is no way to unset them within nvim anymore.


Maybe nvim need a special handle for that situation (konsole+tmux)?
Or, at least, prioritize check for tmux over check for konsole? :shrug: 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Run Konsole or Yakuake
2. run nvim (even `nvim --clean`) and see it changes cursor shapes between normal and insert modes
4. exit nvim, run tmux (with terminal-overriding set up properly and `KONSOLE_*`-variables in `update-environment`)
5. run nvim (even clean) and see it don't change cursor shape at all
6. exit nvim, unset `KONSOLE_*` variables in the shell
7. run nvim again and see, it changes cursor shapes again pretty well

### Expected behavior

 Cursor shape changing works even without unsetting `KONSOLE_*` vars

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

v0.10.0-dev-729+g74bd4aba5-dirty

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

irrelevant

### Operating system/version

Gentoo

### Terminal name/version

Konsole 23.04.2

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color and konsole-256color

### Installation

Official Gentoo package
